markdown: Strategic Publications Development Meeting October 19, 2000 Meeting Recap Attendees: Wyeth-Ayerst: Jamie Durocher, Mark Barbee, Stephanie Brown, Alice Conti DesignWrite: Karen Mittleman (Called In) General Discussion * DW will include more detailed information on target dates for manuscripts; "Anti-aging" strategy paper will be incorporated under "Bundle of Benefits" strategy; Lori Mosca's paper published in _Arch Intern Med_ on Role of HRT in Prevention of CVD will be moved to CVD section. * Grid will need to be filled in with information from **Jamie** and **Gail** on which manuscripts have been distributed, how they've been distributed, and to whom. Strategic Publications Development * Relevance of Clinical Markers for CVD Outcomes (CVD #3)—Alice will follow-up with Matt Rhoa regarding Ridker based on the concern raised by Pam. DW will ensure that paper includes data on NF-kB. * Healthy Endothelium paper (CVD #5)—Alice will contact Koh. Committee needs to provide comments on outline to DW by November 1. (Note: Alice has contacted Koh and he has agreed to author the paper.) * Mammographic Density and HRT (BC #5)—Alice will setup conference call with Fiorica, Tony, Mark, and DW for week of October 30th. (Note: Conference call has been scheduled for November 1st.) * Lanes' Clinical Markers for Osteoporosis Outcomes (BB #7)—Alice will follow-up with Lane and will send her final outline. DW will e-mail Alice the final outline to send to Lane if she agrees to author the paper. (Note: DW sent outline to Alice 10/27/00.) * Communicating persistence/usage and awareness data (Rx #5)—Meeting has been set with legal for the week of October 30th for discussion of moving paper forward. Alice will update committee after the meeting. * Stephanie to check on the status of Lila's paper "Breast Cancer and HRT in Perspective" (BC #4) to be published in *The Female Patient*. (Note: Paper was published in Primary Care Edition in October) * DW will follow-up with Gallagher on The Role of Estrogens in the Management of Postmenopausal Bone Loss (SERMS #3) paper after ASRM. * Update of additional papers in pipeline * Raymond Ke sent HRT and Immune Function paper (BB #4) to *Women's Health in Primary Care* on 9/18/00. * Galley proofs received for Macular degeneration and HRT paper (BB #2). Paper should be published in Nov/Dec issue. * Trudy Bush's review paper (BC #3) and Michele Curtis' review paper (Rx #1) were submitted for the *JAMA* special women's issue. * DW will follow up with Lisa Shulman (BB #3) after ASRM. DUROJ023-001777 Confidential Pursuant to Confidentiality Order Source: Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/rtcw0217

chunks.markdown: Strategic Publications Development Meeting October 19, 2000 Meeting Recap
Attendees: Wyeth-Ayerst: Jamie Durocher, Mark Barbee, Stephanie Brown, Alice Conti DesignWrite: Karen Mittleman (Called In)

General Discussion * DW will include more detailed information on target dates for manuscripts; "Anti-aging" strategy paper will be incorporated under "Bundle of Benefits" strategy; Lori Mosca's paper published in _Arch Intern Med_ on Role of HRT in Prevention of CVD will be moved to CVD section. * Grid will need to be filled in with information from **Jamie** and **Gail** on which manuscripts have been distributed, how they've been distributed, and to whom.

Strategic Publications Development * Relevance of Clinical Markers for CVD Outcomes (CVD #3)—Alice will follow-up with Matt Rhoa regarding Ridker based on the concern raised by Pam. DW will ensure that paper includes data on NF-kB. * Healthy Endothelium paper (CVD #5)—Alice will contact Koh. Committee needs to provide comments on outline to DW by November 1. (Note: Alice has contacted Koh and he has agreed to author the paper.) * Mammographic Density and HRT (BC #5)—Alice will setup conference call with Fiorica, Tony, Mark, and DW for week of October 30th. (Note: Conference call has been scheduled for November 1st.) * Lanes' Clinical Markers for Osteoporosis Outcomes (BB #7)—Alice will follow-up with Lane and will send her final outline. DW will e-mail Alice the final outline to send to Lane if she agrees to author the paper. (Note: DW sent outline to Alice 10/27/00.) * Communicating persistence/usage and awareness data (Rx #5)—Meeting has been set with legal for the week of October 30th for discussion of moving paper forward. Alice will update committee after the meeting. * Stephanie to check on the status of Lila's paper "Breast Cancer and HRT in Perspective" (BC #4) to be published in *The Female Patient*. (Note: Paper was published in Primary Care Edition in October) * DW will follow-up with Gallagher on The Role of Estrogens in the Management of Postmenopausal Bone Loss (SERMS #3) paper after ASRM. * Update of additional papers in pipeline * Raymond Ke sent HRT and Immune Function paper (BB #4) to *Women's Health in Primary Care* on 9/18/00. * Galley proofs received for Macular degeneration and HRT paper (BB #2). Paper should be published in Nov/Dec issue. * Trudy Bush's review paper (BC #3) and Michele Curtis' review paper (Rx #1) were submitted for the *JAMA* special women's issue. * DW will follow up with Lisa Shulman (BB #3) after ASRM.
Confidential Pursuant to Confidentiality Order Source:
